intro: Pristimera unguiculata, commonly known as the slender pristimera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pristimera unguiculata is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it demonstrates adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
